tasks.task: Tilling the gardenland preparation for spring planting
subtasks: Starting the tractor and driving it to the garden
Attaching the disc or plow to the tractor
Surveying the garden to check moisture content
Discing or plowing the garden to turn over weeds and aerate soil
Evaluating the garden's condition after tilling
Manually pulling weeds from between garden rows and plants
Removing as much of the weeds' roots as possible to prevent regrowth
Mixing glyphosate herbicide according to label instructions
Spraying the herbicide on weeds in the garden, being careful not to drift onto desirable plants
Waiting approximately two weeks for the herbicides to take effect and kill the weeds
Preparing the soil after weed control for planting
Collecting soil samples from different parts of the garden
Sending the samples to the local county extension office or garden center
Receiving results to determine soil pH and nutrient levels
Adjusting soil pH using lime or other materials as necessary
Applying recommended fertilizers based on soil test results
